Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What must you do when you hear a siren or see red flashing lights from an ambulance or fire engine?

Answers.Answer: Speed up to get out of the way
Pull over and allow it to pass

Question: You are driving downhill on a steep, narrow road and a vehicle is coming up the hill. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Pull over to the left and give way to the vehicle coming up the hill
Flash the headlights of your vehicle at the vehicle coming up the hill
Sound the horn of your vehicle to get the vehicle coming up the hill out of the way
Do nothing, the vehicle coming up the hill should give way to you

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: There is loose gravel on the road that could break your windscreen
There is broken glass on the road

Question: A broken yellow line painted close to the edge of the road means you may stop or park your vehicle there at any time.
When a flock of sheep are coming towards you on a country road, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Sound the horn on your vehicle to move them out the way
Slow down or pull over to the side of the road
Turn on your vehicle hazard lights and drive on
Drive down the centre of the road

Question: What is the purpose of the 2-second rule?

Answers.Answer: To provide a safe following distance between vehicles traveling at the same speed
To ensure that vehicles have sufficient stopping time when approaching intersections
To avoid gridlocks in congested driving areas
To ensure the speed limit is observed

Question: What is the maximum legal speed limit for a car towing a trailer on the open road?
If you have a learner licence you can carry passengers if your supervisor is in the back seat.
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
When must you pull over and allow an ambulance or fire engine to pass?

Answers.Answer: When it is operating its siren or flashing lights
When it is turning right and you have the right of way

Question: You are coming up to a one-lane bridge and you see this sign. What must you do?

Answers.Answer: Give way to any oncoming vehicles
Only give way to any larger oncoming vehicles
Drive straight ahead but keep to the far left

Question: You should check that there is space for your vehicle on the other side of the crossing before going over a railway level crossing.
When coming up to a roundabout you must give way to all vehicles that will cross your path from your left.
Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
What may you do at traffic signals if there is a green arrow pointing to the right and a red light showing at the same time?

Answers.Answer: You must stop until all lights turn green
You may turn left or right

Question: What is the minimum tread depth required for car tyres?
When driving on an unlaned road, where should your vehicle be positioned?

Answers.Answer: Anywhere, so long as you can see what is coming
Close to the centre of the road
As close to the left side of the road as possible

Question: You look in the mirror and see a cyclist – what should you do when opening the car door?

Answers.Answer: Open the door and expect the cyclist to stop
Open the door and expect the cyclist to swerve
Wait for the cyclist to go past before opening the door
Warn the cyclist by sounding the horn before opening the door

Question: When parking downhill on a steep road, what does the road code suggest that you should do?

Answers.Answer: Leave your keys in the vehicle in case the brakes fail
Turn the front wheels of your vehicle away from the kerb and leave the vehicle in first gear
Turn the front wheels of your vehicle towards the kerb and leave the vehicle in reverse gear
Leave the wheels of your vehicle straight ahead and make sure that the handbrake is on

How close can you park your vehicle to the approach side of a pedestrian crossing where no broken yellow lines have been marked?
If anybody is hurt in a crash, the driver must tell a police officer as soon as possible but within:
You are the driver of the blue car. Of the 4 hazards marked, which one is most likely to require you to take urgent action?
When you have a learner licence you must always drive with a supervisor. A supervisor is a person who has held a current and valid licence for a year.
If you have a front tyre blowout, the vehicle will:

Answers.Answer: pull to the side with the blowout
pull away from the side with the blowout

Question: What does this sign mean?

Answers.Answer: There has been a crash – slow down to 20km/h when passing this sign until you have passed the crash
There have been crashes here in the past – slow down
There has been a crash – but the road is clear now
This is an accident black spot

Question: What should you do if your vehicle breaks down on a motorway?

Answers.Answer: Lift up the bonnet and boot of your vehicle
Push your vehicle to the nearest off-ramp

Question: If you are driving at night with your vehicle headlights on high beam, when MUST you dip them?

Answers.Answer: Approaching a police officer on point duty

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
This sign tells you that you are coming up to a railway level crossing. What should you do?

Answers.Answer: Slow down so that you can look both ways to check that the crossing is clear
Speed up to drive over the crossing as quickly as possible
Stop to check whether the crossing is clear
Turn your vehicle indicators on before driving over the crossing

Question: Does the driver of the blue car have to give way?
To help you from being blinded by the headlights of an oncoming vehicle, what should you do?

Answers.Answer: Look to the left-hand side of the road
Look to the right-hand side of the road
Look to the centre of the road
Turn the headlights of your vehicle onto high beam
